custom_objects.collectionWikiContent:
During an analysis of activities associated with the xHunt campaign that in May and June of 2019 targeted shipping and transportation companies based in Kuwait, Palo Alto's Unit 42 discovered the webpage of a Kuwaiti government organization that had been used for a watering hole attack in another operation conducted by the xHunt threat actors. This operation was conducted from May through December 2019. It was discovered due to the reference to an image file in a webpage that linked to a domain associated with a C&C server used by the Hisoka malware. Analysis of the HTML content showed the attackers may have been attempting to harvest visitors' NTLM credentials by causing their browsers to attempt to connect to a remote share which would require an NTLM challenge-response authentication attempt. Because of this, the attackers may have been able to obtain the account name, NTLM hashes, and some system information from the victim. The attackers could then attempt to crack the hashes. The hashes might also be used to carry out a replay attack. Further indicators, such as DNS redirections, linked the activity to other xHunt activities and also an apparent relationship to activities of the OilRig (aka APT34 and itg13 as identified by IBM) and Chafer (aka APT39 and itg07 as identified by IBM) groups. Further information is available from the Unit 42 report linked in the Reference section below.
# Indicators of Compromise
- IoC's are available from the Reports section on the right.
# Recommendations
- Ensure anti-virus software and associated files are up to date.
- Search for existing signs of the indicated IOCs in your environment.
- Block all URL and IP based IoCs at the firewall, IDS, web gateways, routers or other perimeter-based devices, a course of action, resources or applications to remediate this threat.
- Keep applications and operating systems running at the current released patch level.
# Reference
- [https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/xhunt-campaign-new-watering-hole-identified-for-credential-harvesting/](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/xhunt-campaign-new-watering-hole-identified-for-credential-harvesting/)
